cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 110 miles east of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north then north-northeast, paralleling the southeast U.S. coast, moving near the South Carolina and North Carolina coasts before accelerating northeastward offshore of the Mid-Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Outer Banks of North Carolina (Cape Fear–Cape Lookout area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect from the NC/VA border to Chincoteague VA and Chesapeake Bay south of Smith Point
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Sebastian Inlet FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL and from north of Savannah River to Surf City NC; Storm Surge Warning Jupiter Inlet FL to Surf City NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coast from Florida through the Carolinas with effects extending northward into the Mid-Atlantic and New England waters
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤6%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds; any gusts likely well below gale force inside the Port of Baltimore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None anticipated for the upper Chesapeake Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands may bring roughly 1–3 inches of rain to central Maryland late Friday into Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large swells and dangerous rip currents along the Atlantic entrance and approaches; periods of restricted visibility in heavy showers.
